basic.description: This course provides an integrated overview of the structure and function of the human musculoskeletal and integumentary systems and the diseases and disorders that involve them over the lifespan.  The course integrates knowledge from across the traditional disciplines in basic, behavioral and clinical sciences and applies that knowledge in understanding and treating patients.
basic.subject: BMS
basic.title: Medicine 3 Human Systems in Health and Disease: Musculoskeletal and Integumentary Systems

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: Matriculation to FSU College of Medicine MD program.
